caption: Lovely park to visit. Tourists and Parisians alike enjoy this space. It is fairly big, has statues, beautiful flowers, water attractions, green area and free moveable chairs. I love the idea being able to sit, relax and watch the world go by. Beautiful sounds of birds chirping away. It is free to visit the park. Great park!

Absolutely gorgeous! Even in the fall when many leaves are down.. been to Paris many times but came here for the first time! Yes, this is where Emily in Paris jogs , etc!!! Even near the closing of the park, it is packed with so many Parisian! Everything is beautiful! It is so quaint , peaceful! From young to old, everyone is here! Try to get a chair and enjoy the moment is difficult because it is packed! And yet, it is so peaceful!

I had some time to kill before leaving for the airport and decided to go this garden. Perfect weather that day, lots of children playing boats, people sunbathing, reading books, drawing, jogging, the area is huge, the gardens are beautiful, clean, and well maintained. It's free to public, I got my croissants and ate them by the fountain while people watching.

Beautiful garden, well maintained, open to public, chairs to enjoy evenings, large band to keep you mesmerized. Beautifully manicured garden with colourful flowers and resting chairs all around. A small pool in front of palace building and a vendor renting boats for kids to enjoy. Get at least 2 hours of leisure to enjoy the beauty.

It‚Äôs a beautiful garden in the middle of the city. The. Kids got to play with boats in the main fountain. The grass is perfectly manicured. We visited in November but lots of flowers bloomed. The place  looked lovely
Wow!!! The most beautiful gardens in Paris. We visited in the autumn, the falling leaves and yellow trees were delightful. Amazing atmosphere and truly unmissable for any tourist and local in Paris

Beautiful Garden in Paris, it is free-entrance and open to public, no reservation, just walk-in. The operating hours are varied depending on the season - generally in summer, 7am to 1 hour before sunset, in winter, 8am to 1 hour before sunset. It is a huge garden with different sections for everyone: a garden with tree, bench, statues, or open-space surrounding a pond with benches. One could sit for hours to enjoy the scenery.

This is located near Latin Quarters. The place is very relaxing and is open and free for all. The gardens are very big and beautiful. It is decorated with beautiful statues and fountains. You can relax on grass or sit and enjoy on benches. A perfect place to relax and enjoy the nature. Pro tip: this is one of the great places to have picnic! Bring your food, mat to sit on grass and a glass of wine and have a memorable day!

Our first visit far exceeded expectations! From the gardens to the palace to all the activities people were engaged in. What a wonderful place to walk as well as sit & watch people.  Highly recommend for families too!
Absolutely beautiful.  Love all the activities - pony rides, carousel, Tai chi, active sparring, ROTC type training runs, sitting by the fountain, training sections.

Absolutely incroyable!!! Pictures and videos don't do it justice at all! What a delightful treasure of a place to hang out. You can feel the old energy and the new energy mix and it's amazing.  I could've hung out there all day in the fall weather with my new coat scarf and hat feeling utterly parisienne. Birthday parties over here... small wedding over there.... family portraits in the middle, capturing a truly timeless moment for everyone. Words are far from explanation. I'll be back... with a picnic basket. üòÅ

If you have time to take a break from all the tourism, Lux gardens is the place. It‚Äôs Central Park before there was one. These are October pictures with vibrant colors, people socializing, and a welcome respite with food fare available for every taste. A real gem!

Very beautiful and my 2nd visit here, however I think the gardens can have some additional beauty added and did see some random trash üóë unfortunately that I hadn't seen the 1st time. But definitely take a stroll in your lifetime. ‚Ä¶

It‚Äôs a beautiful and peaceful oasis in the heart of Paris. With its manicured lawns, vibrant flowers, and elegant statues, it‚Äôs the perfect spot for a relaxing stroll or a quiet moment.  A must-visit for anyone looking to escape the city‚Äôs hustle!!!
Too beautiful to be called a garden. You can go here to relax read a book, get good Sun during the winters, have picnics and meet people.

This is the best place to go on picnics and relax on the lounge chairs.. We were lucky to have been in this garden when it  was very sunny..Many people were coming in to soak in the sun..the chairs were running out..there were so many kids around the pond waving their sticks around and watching their toy boats sail away..But I would prefer a greener Luxembourg than the autumn vibe though..

These photos capture the serene and timeless beauty of a historical area in Paris, showcasing lush, tree-lined paths blanketed in golden autumn leaves. The elegant architecture of classical buildings and detailed stone monuments speaks to Paris‚Äôs rich cultural heritage. The fountains, statues, and manicured gardens reflect a sense of refinement and artistic grandeur that has been carefully preserved through centuries. The scenes evoke a peaceful yet majestic atmosphere, inviting both reflection and admiration of the city‚Äôs historic charm and natural beauty.

There is nothing I can say here that 100,000 other reviewers have not already said. ; - ) This park is gorgeous, and quite big! Lots of small areas where you can find your privacy and even sit on the grass. Getting here at early morning is perhaps best. The statues of the great women is special. Enjoy!

Motorized wooden toy boats can be enter for children for 6‚Ç¨ an hour for them to direct in the pond. Formal gardens with gorgeous flowers, statues, water features, fresh air and sunshine. Stroll on through. Grab a bench. Read a book. Relax.

Lovely park with a small fountain with boat rentals. Lots of families about. Plenty of seating and a wheel worth it paid (3 euro a child, 1 euro a adult) park for the children. Plus a small cafe for food. Merci

Crowded on some days, especially the weekend, but totally worth it! Just put on some headphones, listen to your favorite jams, and wander the grounds.  There is plenty of space to find a relaxing perch, and people watch.
Very relaxed. Pretty flowers all over. The lake had little push boats to hire. Place for playing tennis and basketball. Lots of benches and seats to sit and enjoy the environment.

Very open and spacious park for everyone. Tennis court, walking trails, pony rides, Parisian games with iron balls (no clues what they call), sunbathing, scruptures, and many more. Oh and watch out for the poops üí© ‚Ä¶
Beautiful park, with a lot of different birds and places to sit. It doesnt have bathrooms tho, or the only ones we saw were closed‚Ä¶
Love it - beautiful landscaping, great playgrounds for kids, chairs to sit and chill. Get sailboats for the lake, and cash for the carousel.

One of  the most delightful parks I've ever visited. Here are a few, but not all of the reasons why. Beautiful sculptures surrounded by eye catching greenery, flowers and water falls. Trees offering exactly the right balance of shade, wide paths scattered with tastefully unobtrusive metal chairs - what a brilliant idea - visitors can configure these in exactly the number and arrangement that suits them, rather than having to conform to immovable benches that only sit 4 in a row! The orangery  hosted two amazing exhibitions, there was a decent restaurant and takeaway stands, and places where  visitors were allowed to lie on the grass. I've not mentioned everything, (don't want to spoil the surprise!), but would definitely recommend a visit.
Beautiful French and English inspired garden in the 6th arr. There are plenty of benches to just sit and people watch after a day of non-stop walking. Very peaceful and serene
Absolutely my favorite place I visited in Paris!  We sat in the provided chairs around a small pond in the warm summer sun! Not too crowded, but chairs were still mostly full.

Beautiful place with many walk paths to stretch your legs. It can be a bit crowded but nothing that the size of the park can‚Äôt distribute properly :) It‚Äôs a part of the Luxembourg palace which is in use and can‚Äôt be visited.  It‚Äôs a must visit place if in Paris!

The Luxembourg Garden is one of the largest and most beautiful parks in Paris, known for its carefully manicured lawns, tree-lined promenades, flowerbeds, and ornamental statues.  It offers a range of activities and attractions, like a Tennis courts, playgrounds for children, various statues of French queens, famous artists, and even a replica of the Statue of Liberty.
Such a great place to come to if you‚Äôre in Paris. It‚Äôs great to come alone or with friends. I came here in the fall but still a great place to picnic and relax. Enjoy!

We walked around the gardens and we also sat down at the chairs to enjoy the atmosphere. We stayed until the guards and the security of the place whistled to go out. It was funny the way they did it but effective because their voices were loud and everyone could hear them. Overall a beautiful place to visit for free.
One of the most beautiful parks I have seen. People were sitting together, chatting, relaxing or playing cards. Very clean and incredibly beautiful.

So beautiful gardens! Saw so many people just lounging by the muddy waters or just playing around or enjouing the minimal fauna.  Would have liked to spend more time but it was closing time and the guards were blaring their whistles in our ears to skedaddle.
A very beautiful place, and we highly recommend visiting. It‚Äôs perfect for enjoying the fresh air, soaking up the sunshine, and admiring the surrounding beauty.
Immaculate gardens, a great place to spend time relaxing!!! We couldn't stay long, as it was starting to rain, but we'd definitely want to visit it again!!!
Beautiful park perfect for a peaceful afternoon stroll or rest. Lots of chairs to sit. The activities for smaller children close around 19.30
Super chill statue garden. People lounging in chairs and visitors taking pictures. Highly recommended for catching a break during a long day of visiting Paris.
